People really need to get it through their thick skulls that storm razor is an assassin item. Marksmen need to stop claiming items... 
As a marksman, theres one situation where you should be taking storm razor: _When youre already ahead and want to secure that lead with higher burst damage_. Otherwise, its an awful item when infinity edge exists and has been _tailored explicitly for marksmen_.

Meanwhile on assassins, storm razor is the replacement for infinity edge which almost every assassin who didnt build bruiser used to finish their build with. Hell its passive _screams_ "IM FOR CASTERS".

Your claim is so damn wrong. Marksmen want the stormrazor bc all non on hit ADCs want damage and speed, and this is one of the only items that gives that, and its super cheap, and its a huge power spike once you get it to heavily win trades if you get it first. A lot of assassins are casters who dont need the attack speed, while auto attackers do want the speed

A lot of assassins are casters who dont need the attack speed, while auto attackers do want the speed

Okay im gonna start with saying this - _marksman are not the only champions who want attack speed and AD_. Every AD burst champion wants those stats. 
Your reasoning here also proves my point - you want it _when ahead_ to solidify a lead. When behind, its clearly a dang liability because you wont burst as hard as the other person and your DPS isnt going to be as high as theirs.
Your reasoning is exactly how you get the stupid marksmen of a few months ago when they would do extremely high burst per second. 

Storm razor is an item that is very, VERY clearly meant for champions with assassin-esque playstyles who dont want DPS and instead want burst. It is not meant for champions like jinx, but do you understand _why people buy it on her?_ People buy it on her, and its a high winrate item, because on regular marksmen its a _snowball item_ that secures an existing lead. 
Due to the nature of a marksman it can be a viable item on them... But just like many other items, it clearly isnt _meant_ for them in the same way that their other marksman-only items are. 

Lets just.. Math. By the time i have my start of {{item:1038}} {{item:3006}} {{item:3087}} my enemy usually has {{item:3095}} {{item:3006}}. 

Lets say were both level 18 with just the afore mentioned items. I have 1.5asp to their 1.0ASP, and lets say i have 130AD to their 155AD. 
310 damage to  260
465 damage to 390
610 damage to 520+130 (650) (Additional auto due to higher attack speed)
765 damage to 910 (Assuming 1/5 autos crit) 

You see where this is going? They did more burst damage, but the item falls way behind on the DPS output. It is not a marksman item.
It was meant as an optional item for ADC's who want an early powerspike.

Oooor... It was meant as a replacement item for assassins who lost the burst damage of IE when it was reworked and made exclusive to marksmen. 
If you just... take a step back and look at the champions who utilize it best you really see what i mean. And im not talking about "99% Win rate storm razor jinx!"; im talking about champions who consistently utilize it as intended. 
{{champion:133}} {{champion:104}} {{champion:236}} {{champion:119}} {{champion:202}}. Among them, theyre all assassin-esque in playstyle or casters.

There is no "oooor". Assassins are free to use these items as well, but then they have to invest into attack speed and the passive isn't gonna be as strong, because they also decided to make it scale with crit chance to make this item more attractive on ADC's.

You can read the patch notes instead of creating your own narrative about what items are meant for:
https://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/patch/patch-811-notes#patch-items

> 8.11 brings a bunch of changes to **marksman items** and runes, as well as base stat shifts across the roster. We're opening the door for** non-crit builds** to shine by adding or reworking **new tools** for spellslingers and** lane bullies** alike, and by reining in lane sustain to make early aggression a more effective path to victory. Many of these options should be **pretty appealing to AD fighters and assassins as well**, so make sure to check the changes out regardless of your lane preference.

> **Stormrazor**

> Marksman itemization is pretty focus on marksmen who want to stand still and basic attack. With Stormrazor, we're introducing an item for marksmen with longer pauses between attacks, whether they're kiting or just have long attack cooldowns (looking at you, Jhin)

I think the original intention was that Stormrazor would be an earlygame item for crit ADCs to give them some trading potential against lane bullies. It's got no lethality and gives AS, things that assassins dislike. Problem is of course that AD assassins still have high AD so the automatic crit still has a lot of value for them. Then add in Duskblade to stack on top of it and you have a problem. 

Making these two unable to stack should fix the problem because without the stackable Stormrazor + Duskblade procs Stormrazor holds pretty much no value for the vast majority of assassins (Rengar and Nocturne aside, but those would have to choose between Stormrazor and Duskblade as well). Lethality marksmen like MF would also need to make a choice between going for a spellslinger (Duskblade) and auto-attack (Stormrazor) based build.
